title: California's Pioneer Circus: Memoirs and Personal Correspondence Relative to the Circus Business Through the Gold Country in the '50s
description: "A valuable record of the rise and fall of one of America's early and most picturesque circus showmen."Rowe arrived in San Francisco late in 1849 and developed Rowe's Olympic Circus which had performances to April, 1850. He returned to California in 1856 and formed Rowe's Pioneer Circus which continued to perform to late 1857.
author: Joseph Andrew Rowe
